supervise
B2 to watch a person or activity to make certain that everything is done correctly, safely, etc.: The UN is supervising the distribution of aid by local agencies in the disaster area. The children play while two teachers supervise (= make certain that they behave correctly and are safe). Synonyms
manage (CONTROL)
oversee
superintend formal
More examplesFewer examplesThe United Nations is to supervise the handover of the prisoners of war.With 20 kids running round and only two adults to supervise, it was complete mayhem.Foreign officials are supervising the elections.He was employed to supervise the computerization of records.I supervise a team of ten customer relations staff.
